FuncDef:
The ptp notslave disable command sets the notslave attribute to FALSE on an interface.
The undo ptp notslave disable command restores the default notslave attribute value of TRUE on an interface.
The default notslave attribute is TRUE.
By default, the notslave attribute is TRUE.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
ITUT G.8275.1 defines the notslave attribute of an interface. To configure the notslave attribute, run the ptp notslave disable command. If the notslave attribute is set to TRUE, the PTP interface cannot enter the slave state. If the notslave attribute is set to FALSE, the PTP interface can enter the slave state.
This command applies only to G.8275.1 and CU-106.
Prerequisites
The ptp profile g-8275-1 enable command has been run.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
